elements.title: Eugenie Grosup (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an Indian maharajah asked Eugenie Grosup (pictured) to marry him after she received a deportation notice to leave India and return to Nazi-occupied Europe?

elements.title: Clarence McGeary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that football player and coach Clarence McGeary wrestled with Bronko Nagurski, owned bowling alleys with Rocky Marciano, founded the Federation of Christian Athletes, and was awarded a Purple Heart?

elements.title: Al Qarara Cultural Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Al Qarara Cultural Museum, housed in a former grain silo, contained 6000 years of history?

elements.title: Dimitrie Ralet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dimitrie Ralet, a pioneer Romanian orientalist, commended Ottoman reformers for not "blindly adopting what we in Europe take to mean civilization"?

elements.title: their short film (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that PragerU's hashtag #DETRANS, originally meant to promote their short film, was hijacked by Twitter users?

elements.title: Hypericum bupleuroides (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that plant species like Hypericum bupleuroides can reproduce by a callus?

elements.title: son of an engine fitter from England (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the son of an engine fitter from England became Director of Education in part of modern-day South Africa for almost twenty years?

elements.title: 2023 Colorado Mines Orediggers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the No. 1–ranked 2023 Colorado Mines Orediggers, "college football's nerdiest contender", featured players with pigtails and a drawn-on blue mustache, a friar's haircut, and Harry Potter cosplay?
